metadata.title: CVE-2020-14928 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
evolution-data-server (eds) through 3.36.3 has a STARTTLS buffering issuethat affects SMTP and POP3. When a server sends a "begin TLS" response, edsreads additional data and evaluates it in a TLS context, aka "responseinjection."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

evolution-data-server - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
evolution-data-server-common - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
evolution-data-server-tests - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-camel-1.2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-ebackend-1.2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-ebook-1.2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-ebookcontacts-1.2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-ecal-2.0 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-edatabook-1.2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-edatacal-2.0 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-edataserver-1.2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-edataserverui-1.2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libcamel-1.2-62 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libebackend-1.2-10 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libebook-1.2-20 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libebook-contacts-1.2-3 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libecal-2.0-1 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libedata-book-1.2-26 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libedata-cal-2.0-1 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libedataserver-1.2-24 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
libedataserverui-1.2-2 - 3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: evolution-data-server package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.36.3-0ubuntu1.1').
